column7: Coding

column5: Definition of indicator in plain language
column7: Percent of households spending 30% (50%) or more of annual income on housing costs (rent and utilities or mortgage, utilities, property tax, insurance and, if applicable, home association fees
U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS)

column5: Year(s) that the indicator was reported
numeric code for a race/ethnicity group

column7: 1=AIAN; 2=Asian; 3=AfricanAm; 4= Latino; 5=NHOPI; 6=White; 7=Multiple; 8=Other; 9=Total
All income levels
CT=Census tract

census tract, place name, county name, region name, state name

column7: NA for geotype=RE, CA

column7: 01=Bay Area; 02=Butte; 03=Central/Southeast Sierra; 04=Monterey Bay; 05=North Coast; 06=Northeast Sierra; 07=Northern Sacramento Valley; 08=Sacramento Area; 09=San Diego; 10=San Joaquin Valley; 11=San Luis Obispo; 12=Santa Barbara; 13=Shasta; 14=Southern California

Description of housing cost burden strata
column7: ≥ 30% (≥ 50%) of monthly household income consumed by monthly, gross rent; ≥  30%  (≥ 50%) of monthly household income consumed by monthly, selected housing costs; ≥  30% (≥ 50%) of monthly household income consumed by monthly, gross rent or selected housing costs
Rent-paying, renter-occupied households; Mortgage-paying, owner-occupied households; combined rent-/mortgage-paying households

column5: Households paying rent or owner-occupied households paying mortgages; the denominator for this indicator
Households carrying a ≥ 30% (≥ 50%) housing cost burden; the numerator for this indicator
Proportion of households carrying a ≥ 30% (≥ 50%) housing cost burden among total households, multiplied by 100
Relative standard error (se/percent * 100) expressed as a percent

column7: CA_decile groups California census tracts and California places into 10 groups (or deciles) each, for total population. Equal values or 'ties' are assigned the mean decile rank. For example, in a database of 100 records where 70 records equal 0, 0 values span from the 1st to 7th deciles (70% of all data records). As a result, all 0 values will be assigned to the 4th decile: the mean between the 1st and 7th deciles.
Ratio of housing cost burden percent prevalence to California housing cost burden percent prevalence
